intro: Buphthalmum mediterraneum, commonly known as the Mediterranean sunflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces large, showy yellow flowers with a distinctive central disk. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky or coastal areas, where it tolerates dry conditions. Its botanical features make it a notable species in Mediterranean flora.
